hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition - Implied Volatility Compression to Expansion
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 30-day implied volatility (IV) compresses to the bottom 20th percentile of its 90-day range while the market is in NEUTRAL regime, and the 10-day realized volatility (RV) drops below 40% annualized, a volatility expansion event will occur within 5 trading days, with IV rising by at least 15 percentage points.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility tends to cluster and mean-revert. Extreme compression in NEUTRAL regimes often precedes expansion due to positioning (vol sellers overextended) and latent catalysts. The current market news highlights volatility management concerns, suggesting institutional awareness of potential regime shifts.
entry_conditions: BTC 30-day IV ≤ 20th percentile of 90-day IV range
BTC price within ±5% of 20-day moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC 30-day IV increases by 15 percentage points from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC 30-day IV decreases further by 5 percentage points

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: IV remains compressed or declines further beyond 5 trading days without significant expansion (>15pp), indicating structural change in volatility dynamics or persistent low-vol environment.
